content: The Law of Liberty
Receive one who is weak in the faith,  not to disputes over doubtful things.
For one believes he may eat all things, but he who is weak eats  vegetables.
Let not him who eats despise him who does not eat, and let not him who does not eat judge him who eats; for God has received him.
Who are you to judge another’s servant? To his own master he stands or falls. Indeed, he will be made to stand, for God is able to make him stand.
One person esteems  day above another; another esteems every day  Let each be fully convinced in his own mind.

He who observes the day, observes  to the Lord; and he who does not observe the day, to the Lord he does not observe  He who eats, eats to the Lord, for he gives God thanks; and he who does not eat, to the Lord he does not eat, and gives God thanks.
For none of us lives to himself, and no one dies to himself.
For if we live, we live to the Lord; and if we die, we die to the Lord. Therefore, whether we live or die, we are the Lord’s.
For to this end Christ died and rose and lived again, that He might be Lord of both the dead and the living.
But why do you judge your brother? Or why do you show contempt for your brother? For we shall all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
For it is written:
So then each of us shall give account of himself to God.
Therefore let us not judge one another anymore, but rather resolve this, not to put a stumbling block or a cause to fall in  brother’s way.
The Law of Love
I know and am convinced by the Lord Jesus that  nothing unclean of itself; but to him who considers anything to be unclean, to him  unclean.
Yet if your brother is grieved because of  food, you are no longer walking in love. Do not destroy with your food the one for whom Christ died.
Therefore do not let your good be spoken of as evil;
for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the Holy Spirit.
For he who serves Christ in these things  acceptable to God and approved by men.
Therefore let us pursue the things  for peace and the things by which one may edify another.
Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food. All things indeed  pure, but  evil for the man who eats with offense.
good neither to eat meat nor drink wine nor  by which your brother stumbles or is offended or is made weak.
Do you have faith? Have  to yourself before God. Happy  he who does not condemn himself in what he approves.
But he who doubts is condemned if he eats, because  not  from faith; for whatever  not from faith is sin.
